heisig_chinese_memo: In "The Lion King," Scar was the teacher who did all the scheming, and the three hyenas were his pack of wild dogs that did most of the dirty work.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the teacher (師) of dogs (犭) is a lion
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The main subject for the wild dog teacher is how to avoid lions.
humanum_full_description_en: From " dog " to " teacher " sound. " Lion " is the name of a beast, referring to a lion. "Jade articles. Dog Department: "Lions, beasts too." Such as "Book of the Later Han Dynasty." "Western Regions Biography": "Zhang Di Zhang and the first year, sent envoys to present lions and talisman." Zhang Jiuling of the Tang Dynasty "Lion Praise Preface": "There have been from the South China Sea, Jueyou Western Regions, offering its relics, and the lion is in Yan. "
humanum_short_description_en: From " dog " to " teacher " sound. " Lion " is the name of a beast, referring to a lion.
humanum_full_description: 從「犬」，「師」聲。「獅」是猛獸名，指獅子。《玉篇．犬部》：「獅，猛獸也。」如《後漢書．西域傳》：「章帝章和元年，遣使獻獅子、符拔。」唐代張九齡〈獅子贊序〉：「頃有至自南海，厥繇西域，獻其方物，而獅子在焉。」
humanum_short_description: 從「犬」，「師」聲。「獅」是猛獸名，指獅子。

Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 師 indicates the sound; 犭 (animal) conveys the meaning.
Kanshudo mnemonic:the teacher (師) of dogs (犭) is a lion
Chinese: In "The Lion King," Scar was the teacher who did all the scheming, and the three hyenas were his pack of wild dogs that did most of the dirty work.
Meaning: lion
Hanzi: 狮
Story: The main subject for the wild dog teacher is how to avoid lions.
Kind: traditional
從「 犬 」，「 師 」聲。「 獅 」是猛獸名，指獅子。《玉篇．犬部》：「獅，猛獸也。」如《後漢書．西域傳》：「章帝章和元年，遣使獻獅子、符拔。」唐代張九齡〈獅子贊序〉：「頃有至自南海，厥繇西域，獻其方物，而獅子在焉。」
From " dog" to " teacher" sound. " Lion" is the name of a beast, referring to a lion. "Jade articles. Dog Department: "Lions, beasts too." Such as "Book of the Later Han Dynasty." "Western Regions Biography": "Zhang Di Zhang and the first year, sent envoys to present lions and talisman." Zhang Jiuling of the Tang Dynasty "Lion Praise Preface": "There have been from the South China Sea, Jueyou Western Regions, offering its relics, and the lion is in Yan. "

獅字的基本解释

獅
shī
见“狮”。

獅字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shī］
［《廣韻》疏夷切，平脂，生。］
“狮1”的繁体字。
(1)狮子。
(2)犬生二子称“獅”。

獅字的康熙字典解释

【巳集下】【犬字部】　獅； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页717第10
【廣韻】疏夷切【集韻】【韻會】霜夷切，?音師。【玉篇】猛獸也。【爾雅·釋獸】狻麑。【註】卽獅子也。漢順帝時疎勒王來獻犎牛及獅子。東觀記：疎勒王遣使文時詣闕，獻獅子，似虎，正黃有髥耏，尾端茸毛大如斗。◎按後漢書順帝紀作師。【正字通】獅，牡者有耏髥，尾大如斗。怒則威在齒，喜則威在尾。毎一吼，百獸辟易。一名白獸。　又【廣韻】犬生二子。〇按爾雅釋畜：犬生二師，作師。

lion
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Si Ji 2] [Dog Character Department] 　 Lion; Kangxi Strokes: 14; Page Number: Page 717 No. 10
[Guang Yun] Shuyi cut [Jiyun] [Yunhui] Shuangyi cut,? Musician. [Jade articles] Beasts too. 【Erya·Shu Beast】Fat. [Note] Also a lion. When Emperor Shun of the Han Dynasty, King Jiule came to offer oxen and lions. Eastern View: The king of Jiule sent an envoy to the text when he was que, presenting a lion, like a tiger, the yellow is full of hair, and the tail is as big as a fight. ◎According to the post-Han Shu Shun Emperor Ji composer. 【Zhengzitong】The lion and the male have a scorpion and the tail is as big as a fight. Wrath brings prestige in the teeth, happiness brings prestige in the tail. With every roar, all beasts make changes. A white beast.　[Guangyun] The dog gave birth to two sons. 〇According to Erya to release animals: the second teacher of dog students, as a teacher.
